title: Kamil Sobota
text:
Kamil Mihail Sobota (born 31 March 1992) is a <a href="Romanian%20people">Romanian</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> football player. He plays as a <a href="Lock%20%28rugby%20union%29">lock</a> for professional <a href="SuperLiga%20%28rugby%29">SuperLiga</a> club <a href="ACS%20Tomitanii%20Constan%C8%9Ba">Tomitanii Constanța</a>.
Club career.
Kamil Sobota started playing rugby in his hometown of Cluj-Napoca at Universitatea but finished his junior years in Bucharest at Dinamo. His first professional club was Dinamo, joining the senior squad after ending his junior years. For a brief period of time he returned to Universitatea Cluj, moving after one season once again in Bucharest, this time joining CSM. After 4 seasons with <a href="CSM%20Bucure%C8%99ti%20%28rugby%29">CSM București</a> he tranfsered to <a href="ACS%20Tomitanii%20Constan%C8%9Ba">Tomitanii Constanța</a> in 2019 following the dissolution of his former club.
International career.
Sobota is also selected for Romania's national team, the <a href="Romania%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Oaks</a>, making his international debut during the Week 2 of <a href="2020%20Rugby%20Europe%20Championship%23Week%202">2020 Rugby Europe Championship</a> in a test match against the "<a href="Portugal%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Os Lobos</a>".
